sentence.Network_en: Text served, additionally to canonize belief.
sentence.Network_cn: 此外, 文本被用于宣布信仰为圣.

sentence.Network_en: There a temptation to rush, to canonize your memory. There is no need to do so.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在有股风潮,大家争抢对你的回忆, 实在没有必要这样做.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin canonizare 'admit as authoritative' (in medieval Latin 'admit to the list of recognized saints'), from Latin canon (see canon)

entry.tran: (在天主教中）封（死者）为圣徒,封圣
entry.def: If a dead person is canonized, it is officially announced by the Catholic Church that he or she is a saint.

example.ex: Joan of Arc was finally canonized by Pope Benedict XV in 1920.
example.tran: 圣女贞德终于在1920年由教皇本尼狄克十五世封为圣徒。

means.word_mean: 1. in the Catholic church; declare (a dead person) to be a saint;

sentences.sentence: "After he was shown to have performed a miracle, the priest was canonized"

means.word_mean: 3. add in the canon or calendar of the saints;

sentences.sentence: "He was canonized not long after his death"

auth_sentence.content: Inclined to vilify the informers and canonize the resisters.
auth_sentence.res_content: Inclined to vilify the informers and canonize the resisters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Inclined to vilify the informers and canonize the resisters.

sentences.en: Two years after his death the bishop was canonized.
sentences.cn: 主教逝世两年后被正式封为圣者。
